intro: Mouriri barinensis, commonly known as the Barinense mouriri, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom during the wet season. It is often found growing in moist, shaded areas along riverbanks and in dense tropical forests. The fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind and animals.
